data.name: Prov Trading Post est
data.desc: Prov Co authorise Gov of Prov Sussex Camockâ€™s establishment of a trading post at Cape Gracias a Dios for regular trade with Miskitu, thereafter establishing alliance with Miskito
data.agents_nsp0: Gov Sussex Camock, Capt Samuel Axe, Nathaniel Goodman, Abraham Blauvelt 50 men
data.prim_n: CO 124/1 [10 May 1632 / 10 Apr, 1 Jul 1633 / Prov Co to Gov and Council by the Long Robert Sep 1634 / Prov Co to Bell by the Expectation Feb or Mar 1635] / CO 124/2 [22 May 1633, 24 Dec 1634] / Egerton MS 2646 f 58
data.note:
Records of survey notes of Expedition, which apparently split into separate groups, likely not extant /v Kupperman 100
 Aug 1634 Prov Co to Camock. Warn against overfishing turtles, since it would hurt trade with Miskitus /v Genkins 73-74 /CO 124/1
 Mar 1636 Capt Axe charged with unprovoked 'slaughter of diverse Indians by the Eng under [his] command' /v Genins 74 /CO 124/1 / < May 1636 Capt Axe secures Dutch letter of marque /v Genkins 86 /[missg]
 Spring 1636 Trade Post abandoned /v Genkins 74 /[missg]
 < Jun 1636 Cape Gracias a Dios. Two Du Capts fm Flushing land c 200 slaves among Mos Indians, possibly to be picked up later by Capt Willem Blauvelt aboard ship Expectation for Prov Co /v Thornton 5-6 /GUATEMALA,L.16,R.2,N.13 ff 30, 43v-44 /CO 124/2 ff 150, 152 / Slaves possibly fm Angola ship captured off Zamba Point near Cartagena /v Thornton 8 /SANTA_FE,40,R.2,N.34 ff 1-4 [Murga a 5 ago 1636]
 1633 R Tinto [Cape Gracias a Dios]. Capt Cammock arrives on trading expedition, est trading post in Cape Gracias a Dios for Prov Co /v Obando 11-12
